title: Vertical Hydroponic Farming: Grow More Food in Less Space  A Beginner's Guide

tasks.task: Farmers adapting to urbanization and growing demand for local produce.
subtasks: Understanding traditional farming challenges (space, weather dependency, water usage).
Exploring vertical hydroponic farming as a solution.
Describing hydroponic principles and benefits (efficient space, water, and pesticide use).
Choosing the right system (towers, A-frames, NFT) based on space and needs.
Considering light exposure and plant growth.
Selecting suitable crops (leafy greens, herbs, small fruits).

tasks.task: Achieving sustainable agriculture through vertical hydroponics.
subtasks: Minimizing environmental impact (low water usage, reduced emissions).
Enhancing food security and freshness in urban areas.
Promoting local production and reducing transportation carbon footprint.
